title: (x) "streghe" unknown italic - Hershey-Plain-Triplex-Italic {Raph}
content:
Hi, I need to identify this italic type. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808225422im_/http:/typophile.com/files/streghe01%20provalogo.jpg)

 [‹ (x) IKEA serif face - New Century Schoolbook (custom version) {Geoff}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808225422/http:/typophile.com/node/19149 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) 3 mobile company corporate faces - Verona, Modena {Alexey} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808225422/http:/typophile.com/node/19138 "Go to next forum topic")
author: franzlt

comments.content: It’s Hershey-Plain-Triplex-Italic, a primitive stroke font designed for pen plotters.

Emigre makes chocolate too?

BTW, I don’t know if I’d call it primitive. You can see at least  
two sophisticated features: the extra-slanted pothook of the “h”,  
and the pulled-in top curve in the “g”.

hhp

\> _You can see at least two sophisticated features: the extra-slanted pothook of the “h”, and the pulled-in top curve in the “g”._

And don’t forget those delicate and very rare block terminals. :^P
